Yes, there are some tea blends that are traditionally considered helpful for digestion. Here are a few examples:

1. Ginger tea - Ginger has natural anti-inflammatory properties that may help soothe an upset stomach. Drinking ginger tea may also help relieve nausea and improve digestion.

2. Peppermint tea - Peppermint contains menthol, which can help soothe the digestive tract and reduce bloating, gas, and cramping. It can also help regulate bowel movements.

3. Fennel tea - Fennel is known to help relax the muscles of the digestive system, which can reduce bloating and relieve constipation.

4. Chamomile tea - Chamomile has anti-inflammatory properties that may help reduce inflammation in the digestive system. It can also have a calming effect on the body, helping to reduce stress, which can contribute to digestive issues.

5. Licorice root tea - Licorice root has been used for centuries to aid digestion. It contains compounds that help protect the stomach lining and can soothe digestive discomfort.

However, while tea blends may offer some digestive benefits, it's important to remember that significant digestive issues should always be addressed by a medical professional. Drinking tea should not be used as a substitute for medical treatment.
